Description: Three joined fragments of Attic black-figure painted pottery belly amphora. Part of head of bearded man with long hair and fillet, to right. Purple on all flesh except ear, and for inner frame.
Curator's comments: Six fragments from Tell Dafana (BM GR 1888,0208.92a, 1888,0208.92b, 1952,0505.22, 1952,0505.23, 1888,0208.105a, 1952,0505.24) are from one-piece amphorae with panels containing the head of a bearded man or of a horse. Cook suggests that these fragments may belong to as few as two amphorae. The fragment Philadelphia E154.1, also from Tell Dafana, is from a similar amphora or from one of these amphorae (Cook CVA British Museum 8, p. 43).
Bibliographic references: Vase / Catalogue of Vases in the British Museum (B125.11)
CVA British Museum 8 / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum: Great Britain 13, British Museum 8 (Pl. GB 609, 5)
Weber 2012 / Untersuchungen zur archaischen griechischen Keramik aus anderen ägyptischen Fundorten (TD 9)
